abstract: Marks the end of an undo group.
overview:
## Discussion

All individual undo operations back to the matching [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/beginUndoGrouping()] message are grouped together and reversed by a later [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/undo()] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/undoNestedGroup()] message. Undo groups can be nested, thus providing functionality similar to nested transactions. Raises an `NSInternalInconsistencyException` if there’s no [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/beginUndoGrouping()] message in effect.

This method posts an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSNotification/Name-swift.struct/NSUndoManagerCheckpoint] and an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSNotification/Name-swift.struct/NSUndoManagerDidCloseUndoGroup] just before the group is closed.

# endUndoGrouping()

**Instance Method**

Marks the end of an undo group.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func endUndoGrouping()
```

## Discussion

All individual undo operations back to the matching [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/beginUndoGrouping()] message are grouped together and reversed by a later [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/undo()] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/undoNestedGroup()] message. Undo groups can be nested, thus providing functionality similar to nested transactions. Raises an `NSInternalInconsistencyException` if there’s no [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/beginUndoGrouping()] message in effect.

This method posts an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSNotification/Name-swift.struct/NSUndoManagerCheckpoint] and an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSNotification/Name-swift.struct/NSUndoManagerDidCloseUndoGroup] just before the group is closed.

## Related Documentation

- **levelsOfUndo**: The maximum number of top-level undo groups the undo manager holds.

## Creating undo groups

- **beginUndoGrouping()**: Marks the beginning of an undo group.
- **groupsByEvent**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the manager automatically creates undo groups around each pass of the run loop.
- **groupingLevel**: The number of nested undo groups (or redo groups, if redo is the most recent operation) in the current event loop.
